GPT_response.title: Core inflation may bottom out around 4%
GPT_response.background: Inflation refers to the general increase in prices of goods and services over time. Core inflation specifically measures the change in prices excluding volatile items like food and energy. The current trend suggests that core inflation may stabilize at around 4%, indicating a relatively stable and controlled price level.
GPT_response.summary: Top electronic companies like Apple, Samsung, Dixon Technologies, and Havells have experienced a decline in imports as a percentage of sales in the last fiscal year compared to the pre-Covid period. This reduction is in line with the emphasis on local manufacturing and reduced dependence on imports. In related news, PepsiCo India is likely to appoint George Kovoor as president, following the relocation of the incumbent Ahmed ElSheikh to a global role. Kovoor, an experienced executive, is expected to lead the company's operations in India.
